You will play
your part.

I want to coordinate
it myself,

receiving views, taking the
living pulse of our country.

I would like us to have a discussion
about this famous debate,

because to be clear, there is
a lot at stake in this matter.

I am – how
can I put it? –

I think that what the French people have
expressed is profound and serious.

But on the climate, basically,
there we want an agenda

of solutions.
And after,

we'll have the topics, because we
have to focus on these points,

related to crime and immigration,
which will come back,

because security and immigration,
is people’s primary concern,

and we cannot
ignore this fact.

And I think there should be
a theme,

no doubt, with concrete proposals
that people have,

what the Minister said
is very accurate,

what are the elements
that they want to focus on

to bring change to
their daily lives?

What we are witnessing
is the malaise of modest workers

who can no longer get by
because of

taxation, charges and, above all
cost constraints,

they no longer have any visibility,
a loss of control over their lives.

It's a democratic discontent and
I think there are three ways

of dealing with it.
One way is to say:

"we disagree" and
we have to own this disagreement,

by saying:
"you have expressed yourselves,

but this is why we
won't take this on board".

There is another option
which is to say:

"let’s put it to a referendum",
which is what the minister said and it's very strong.

And there is a third option
which is: "we take it and do it".
